name: German
descriptions: The German program at TCU combines language acquisition with cultural understanding, engaging students in German business, economy, politics, and cultural norms. The curriculum pairs German-language courses with interdisciplinary offerings in history, music, philosophy, business, communications, and politics.

German is the most widely spoken language in Europe, and Germany is the largest European economy and a major U.S. trading partner. Students can earn internationally recognized Goethe-Institut language certification through exams administered on campus in collaboration with the Dallas Goethe Center.

courses: MOLA 20003 - Cosmopolitanism: Thinking from a Global Perspective - 3 hrs. (gateway)

electiveCourses.description: Three courses taught in German at the 30000+ level (at least one at 40000+), plus two courses with ARAB, CHIN, FREN, GRMN, ITAL, JAPN, or MOLA prefix (max one taught in English). May include one interdisciplinary course with advisor approval.
